timeline.message: Implemented data source selection and updated the HTML and KML modules to respond to these selections
Codacy fixes and small interface changes
Null fix and some clean up
Added yes-no dialog if there are zero data source selections

timeline.bodyText: How does making this getter public tie into the solution?
timeline.author: rcordovano

replies.bodyText:
The KML report pulls routes, tracks and waypoints from certain artifacts across the entire case. By making this public, I was able to get at the underlying artifact to filter the data source. However, I see that Track.getTracks(), for example, accepts a list of content objects to filter by. Routes.getRoutes() and Waypoints don't have this, but maybe a better idea is to add methods in these classes.
Should I just ask Kelly what would be the best approach?
replies.author: dannysmyda

timeline.bodyText: Is making this Serializable looking towards the future?
timeline.author: rcordovano

replies.bodyText: No, from what I remember all settings are first assembled -> then serialized -> then deserialized -> then given to the modules. Going to disk is a necessary step in the pipeline.
replies.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText: I had that at first, but don't you think selected has a UI orientation?
replies.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText: Not really - selection can also happen via command line args or entries read from a configuration file. I was thinking that process sounded a little heavy-duty for reporting. It's not a big deal though.
replies.author: rcordovano
